topics.name: How do I know if someone is being harassed and what should I do?

questions.question: Is the person someone you know?
Have you noticed a change in their behaviour?
Are they in the middle of a disagreement/being harassed right now?
Have you noticed any of the following: - Sad or withdrawn? - Defensive or angry? - Avoiding you or others?
Have you noticed any physical changes (i.e. bruising or other physical marks?)
Are they in any immediate danger?
Do they appear to be distressed or watching out for something or someone?
This person is possibly being abused/harassed. Reach out first, ask how they are, let them know you care. Look for any physical/behavioural changes.
Are you comfortable reaching out to this person?
This person may be suffering from mental abuse. Please reach out to them first, let them know you care.
Send out a distress signal now to alert appropriate authority.
They may be avoiding someone. Offer to take them to a safe place. Stay with them, make sure you are in an open area and visible to people. Alert authorities.
Try reaching out to the individual to ask how they are and if they require any assistance. Mention any red flags that you may have noticed.
This person is most likely being abused/harassed. Reach out to them immediately, let them know what you observed and that you care. Alert authorities.
This person is most likely being abused/harassed. Contact the authorities immediately.
How do I know if someone is being harassed and what should I do?
